com.report.csv.gen

Class CSVGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.report.csv.gen.CSVGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CSVTool

    public class CSVGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements CSVTool
    CSV Generator is used to assign the jobs to Header, Row and Writer.

    CSV Header - Collect the Header Information.

    CSV Row - Collect the Rows and Columns Information.

    CSV Writer - Perform File Write Operation via Write Stream.

    Author:
    VIGNESH R

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSVGenerator

        public CSVGenerator(java.lang.String csvFileName,
                    java.lang.String filePath,
                    boolean permit)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor with Default Parameters.

        1.Construct the file path and file name for CSV.

        2.Generate the Directory path if not exist.

        3.Assign the FileWriter Stream in to Writer.

        4.Assign the File Permission.

        Parameters:
        csvFileName - Name of the CSV File.
        filePath - Path of the given CSV File.

        Example: C:\\CSVFiles\\Generated\\.... If the path not exist it will automatically created.

        permit - To set the File permissions.

        If true, Strict the file READONLY file permission. So, cannot overwrite or edit the file informations and contents.

        If false, Strict the file READ and WRITE permission.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IOException

      • CSVGenerator

        public CSVGenerator(java.lang.String csvFileName,
                    java.lang.String filePath,
                    boolean permit,
                    char... lineDelim)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor with Line Delimeter or Separator. 1.Construct the file path and file name for CSV. 2.Generate the Directory path if not exist. 3.Assign the FileWriter Stream in to Writer. 4.Assign the File Permission. 5.Assign the delimiter for line separator.

        Parameters:
        csvFileName - Name of the CSV File.
        filePath - Path of the given CSV File.

        Example: C:\\CSVFiles\\Generated\\.... If the path not exist it will automatically created.

        permit - To set the File permissions.

        If true, Strict the file READONLY file permission. So, cannot overwrite or edit the file informations and contents.

        If false, Strict the file READ and WRITE permission.

        lineDelim - The Default line delimiter is '\n' or else using System Property to get the line.separator.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IOException

               throws CSVException

      • set

        public void set(int index,
                java.lang.Object value)
         throws CSVException
        Description copied from interface: CSVTool
        Set the row values using header index position.The content is based on header content.

        Specified by:
        set in interface CSVTool
        Parameters:
        index - Integer value presents column position or index position based on header content.
        value - The value is declared as object.

        So the input values will be any Primitive Data types and String.

        char,byte,short,int,long,double,float,boolean and String. Date, Email, URL is parsed by String Values using com.report.csv.util.CSVParser.

        Throws:
        CSVException - throws CSVException

      • set

        value - The value is declared as object.

        So the input values will be any Primitive Data types and String.

        char,byte,short,int,long,double,float,boolean and String. Date, Email, URL is parsed by String Values using com.report.csv.util.CSVParser.

        Throws:
        CSVException - throws CSVException
